This Month in History July - Just about everyone in the United 
States has heard of the little town known as Roswell, N.M. Most people know that there is some connection 
between Roswell 
and UFOs. But not many people know the real details. Read more about this and other major events that happened in the month of July.    This week's trivia question:Where does the "rocket's red glare" line in the National Anthem come from? 
Find out here   
 

How Atomic Clocks Work - Atomic clocks keep incredibly accurate time. Some atomic
clocks lose less than one second every million years. In this article, learn
how atomic clocks were developed, which atoms are used in the most accurate
clocks and whether or not atomic clocks are radioactive.
    This week's video:

How a C-130 is Built - The C-130 is one of the largest and most powerful cargo
planes in the world. Find out how such a mammoth aircraft works in this
HowStuffWorks video.
     
Also at HowStuffWorks: 
Slingbox: Take Your TV With You
 - "Placeshifting" technology takes your television signal and sends it to you anywhere in the world. With a device like Slingbox, you can watch your TIVO recordings if you're traveling on business or on vacation. In this article, learn how Slingbox allows you to enjoy your favorite TV shows remotely. 
 
How Stinger Missiles Work - Stinger missiles are a highly effective, shoulder-launched missile system used by terrorist and militaries alike. Learn how the Stinger missile and its infrared-tracking technology work, as well as about its use on the battlefield. 
 
How Rocket Engines Work - Rocket engines are the tremendously powerful devices that make space travel possible. Learn about the technology behind rocket engines and about the differences between solid-fuel and liquid-propellant rockets.
